metadata.Title: CVE-2022-40674 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
libexpat before 2.4.9 has a use-after-free in the doContent function inxmlparse.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40674` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.2.5-3ubuntu0.8
libexpat1 - 2.2.5-3ubuntu0.8
No subscription required

firefox - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cadaver: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').

firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
